sources.title: 1968 - Run, Man, Run - $3 million in gold! Western film - scored by Ennio Morricone
sources.description:
Blade-slinging Cuchillo Sanchez races to recover $3M in revolutionary gold while outsmarting foreign agents, bandits, a cunning bounty hunter, and his impatient fiancée. With thrilling chases and shifting alliances, this wild treasure hunt proves survival is the ultimate hustle!

Original title: Corri uomo corri
Alternative title: Run, Man, Run

Directed by Sergio Sollima
Written by Sergio Sollima, Pompeo De Angelis
Music by Ennio Morricone (The Good, the Bad and the Ugly, Once Upon a Time in the West)

Main cast:
Tomas Milian - Manuel 'Cuchillo' Sanchez
Donald O'Brien - Nathaniel Cassidy
Linda Veras - Penny Bannington
John Ireland - Santillana
Chelo Alonso - Dolores
Marco Guglielmi - Colonel Michel Sévigny
José Torres - Ramirez
Luciano Rossi - Jean-Paul
Nello Pazzafini - Riza
Gianni Rizzo - Mayor Christopher Bannington

Genres: Western, Adventure, Comedy
Release date: 29 August 1968 
Filming location: Spain & Italy

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics

sources.title: Run, Man, Run (1968)
sources.description: Corri Uomo Corri (1968), also known as Run, Man, Run , is a Spaghetti Western directed by Sergio Sollima. The film revolves around a character named Tomas Milian , who portrays a Mexican bandit named Cuchillo .  Cuchillo, who is adept at avoiding violence, gets caught up in the turmoil of the Mexican Revolution. He discovers that a group of revolutionaries are attempting to steal a large cache of gold intended for the federal army. As the revolution escalates, Cuchillo tries to navigate this treacherous landscape while evading both the revolutionaries and the law. Throughout the film, viewers see Cuchillo's humorous yet cunning tactics to survive, his encounters with various characters, and the moral complexities of the revolution. Eventually, he becomes entangled in the very conflicts he wishes to avoid, leading to a series of action-packed, often satirical, events. It is the second film of Sergio Sollima centred on the character of Cuchillo, again played by Tomas Milian, after the two-years earlier successful western The Big Gundown. It is also the final chapter of the political-western trilogy of Sollima, which includes Face to Face, and his last spaghetti western.

metadata.Plot: A knife-wielding Mexican ne'er-do-well is tasked by a scholar with locating $3 million in revolutionary gold, and finds himself working and competing with various parties for it.
metadata.Actors: Tomas Milian, Donald O'Brien, Linda Veras
